UI_visible_response: The number of deaths attributed to air pollution in China has varied over recent years according to different studies and reports. In 2017, it was estimated that 1.24 million deaths were attributable to air pollution in China1. By 2019, this figure was approximately 1.85 million deaths as a result of air pollution, which showed a slight decrease from the numbers in 19903. Another report suggests that air pollution is responsible for about 2 million deaths in China per year, with ambient air pollution alone causing more than 1 million deaths4. These figures highlight the significant impact of air pollution on public health in China.
traffic_visible_response: The number of deaths attributed to air pollution in China has varied over recent years according to different studies and reports. In 2017, it was estimated that 1.24 million deaths were attributable to air pollution in China [[1]]. By 2019, this figure was approximately 1.85 million deaths as a result of air pollution, which showed a slight decrease from the numbers in 1990 [[3]]. Another report suggests that air pollution is responsible for about 2 million deaths in China per year, with ambient air pollution alone causing more than 1 million deaths [[4]]. These figures highlight the significant impact of air pollution on public health in China.
